functions.ImageReadFunctions library¶

ImageReadFuncs class¶

functions.ImageReadFunctions.ImageReadFuncs.AutoContrast(im: Mat) → Mat[source]¶

Automatically applies contrast to an image and returns it

Parameters¶

im : cv2.Mat

the image(im) that will be applied contrast to

Returns¶

cv2.Mat

image with contrast applied to it

functions.ImageReadFunctions.ImageReadFuncs.ClipArray(array: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

Clips values away from array based on percentile.

Extended Sumamry¶

The clipping is done to values outside 10 - 99 percentile.

Values such as nan are changed to 0 and inf are changed to 1

Parameters¶

array : np.ndarray

any form of numpy array with unclipped values.

Returns¶

np.ndarray

the array with values clipped.

functions.ImageReadFunctions.ImageReadFuncs.ConvertTo8U(im: Mat) → Mat[source]¶

Takes an image and converts it to uint8. Usually to make other cv2 functions work.

Parameters¶

im : cv2.Mat

the image(im) to be converted, usually .tiff or .tif.

Returns¶

cv2.Mat

the converted image.

functions.ImageReadFunctions.ImageReadFuncs.GetDistanceFromPath(path: str) → float[source]¶

Searches path to extract distance along z-axis with underscore(_) being the seperator.

Parameter¶

path : str

the path that the distance will be extracted from.

Returns¶

float

a value for the distance that the images was taken from.
